intro: Sphaerostigma micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered globular fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit. The plant features delicate, leathery fronds that are often covered in a fine, powdery bloom. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically borne in clusters on the underside of the fronds. Sphaerostigma micranthum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
